title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When using the XML Report Designer editor, if you make edits in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then try to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed indicating that you need to save your changes. However, the error message is not very clear and does not provide clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes. The error message is titled 'Error' and the content of the message is 'Source page is dirty'. As a result, the user is left to figure out how to proceed and it is especially difficult to figure out how to discard the changes. The user should be provided clear instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
OB: When attempting to switch from the 'source' view to the Layout view in the XML Report Designer editor after making edits, an error message is displayed titled 'Error' with the content 'Source page is dirty'.
EB: When attempting to switch from the 'source' view to the Layout view in the XML Report Designer editor after making edits, a clear and informative error message should be displayed, providing instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
SR:
1. Open the XML Report Designer editor.
2. Switch to the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Make some edits to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message stating that the source page is dirty.

Expected Result: A clear and informative error message is displayed, providing instructions on how to save or discard the changes.
